alert.note: Alert for City of Newport News; City of Poquoson; James City; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 7:52AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, City of Newport News, City of Poquoson, James City and York. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 752 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport News, Hampton, Williamsburg, Patrick Henry Field, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Seaford, Christopher Newport University, Gloucester Point, Denbigh, Lee Hall, Tabb, Fort Eustis, Beaconsdale, Grove, Busch Gardens, Carver Gardens, York Terrace, Kings Point, Jamestown and Newport News Golf Course. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Newport News; City of Poquoson; James City; York
